answers.answer: Yes but not that far 3 weeks for me, I'm meant to be 21 weeks + 3 days but they are very much determined he is much further along. They will defiantly be able to tell you in 6 weeks x
Could be that you have too much fluid.
Have they done a gestational diabetes test?
Your belly is measuring big? If so, that is an indication for ultrasound to measure baby. Indication would be called "uterine size/date discrepancy".  Personally, I think waiting 6 weeks is too long.

No I'm not waiting 6 weeks sorry I wrote that wrongI have a sono on 4 weeks measuring 6weeks ahead!And no he wasn't me in tomorrow to take the GD to rule that out... Crazy thing is I had my anatomy scan 3 weeks ago he was measuring perfect she said fluids were good everything was on track...Could I all of sudden be further along?!Or had this happened to anyone and ended up having the baby early due to being so big?

A scan in 4 weeks sounds legit if you were recently scanned. Shouldn't scan for fetal growth at less than 3 week intervals. Did you gain some weight quickly?  Not to sound harsh, but I have said many times on this app...if your due date was accurately established by 1st trimester scan, it should not be changed.
14lbs and I'm "24w" my doc said my weight gain is right on track.. Just so lost lol like whens my baby coming lol
I'm measuring smaller than I should be. Im not sure what going to happen.

How was your due date established? LMP that agreed with scan or by 1st trimester scan? Growth disturbances, whether small or large usually will show at about 28 weeks or after. "Large for gestational age" babies typically do not occur at 24 weeks. These statements are not universal though. Be patient. Your next scan will provide info the doc needs.
I sure hope so! As long as he's ok I'll do what I have too!

question: 24w dr measured me 30w today umm 6w he scheduled me another ultrasound has this happened to anyone else?
title: Measuring 6w ahead?!?!?!
